DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Cisplatin is a type of chemotherapy drug called an alkylating agent. It contains the metal platinum, which binds to and damages the cellâ€™s DNA, preventing it from being repaired or copied. This stops cells from dividing and causes them to die.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Cisplatin is approved to be used alone or with other drugs to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Bladder cancer. It is used alone in patients with advanced cancer that cannot be treated with other therapies, such as surgery or radiation therapy.

Ovarian cancer that has spread to other parts of the body. It is used with other drugs in patients who have already had surgery or radiation therapy. It is used alone in patients whose cancer has not gotten better with standard chemotherapy and who have not received previous cisplatin.
Testicular cancer that has spread to other parts of the body. It is used with other drugs in patients who have already had surgery or radiation therapy.

Section.Para: Cisplatin is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
